properties.name: Advance America
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where I worked after getting my BA in History. I worked here for a year, giving pay day loans. I had a really nice co-worker here named Jonny that I just absolutely loved. Next door to the pay day loan joint was a Verizon place and that\'s where I met Mr. Ramierez before he got the job out in the area. He was a nice guy with aspirations to be a nudist. We still talk from time to time. It was a phone in this office that I used to call the university to inquire about grad school and also to call Heraclio to tell him we were going.

properties.name: Ava Hesser's Childhood Home
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where Ava Hesser lived before she moved to Alaska the summer before freshman year. I spent more time here during middle school than I did any where else. Ava and I kept in contact and have been friends for literally over half of our lives. In 2006 I was maid of honor at her wedding; fulfilling her half of the promise we made to each other in the in sixth grade. Her cousin lived in the house after Ava moved and I dated him for a little while. It was weird going over there.

properties.name: Bateman's Island
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiNice to explore but ugly in some places and sometimes scary in the evening, Bateman\'s Island is a good place for jogging or walking. There are lots of wildlife here though, and in the summer I\'ve heard that you have to watch for rattlesnakes, though I\'ve never encountered one here.

properties.name: Denny's
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is the Denny\'s I used to go to when I\'d leave the house in the middle of the night during high school. They never checked ID\'s so I always sat in the smoking section, copying down my favorite quotes from my Shakespeare book or writing stories and poems. Robin used to walk here from her house and order a carafe of orange juice. This is also the place Malissa and I went after we left my mother to sleep in the Hospital the week before she died.

properties.name: Emerald of Siam: The 48 Hour Date
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where Josh and I had dinner the first night of what became a 48 hour date. What started as a date just kept going and going. Before we knew it we had spent two days together without a break. Since then, we\'ve not spent more than a 24 hour period without seeing each other. That was two years ago.

properties.name: Fishhook Park
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is a nice place for family swimming. There is a little area that is roped off for kids and there arent many geese in this area. There are also little docks to tie a boat, so this is also a great jumping off point for some really scenic boating, skiing and tubing. There is also camping in this area but it dosnt seem prime.

properties.name: Hanford High: Site of my Practicum
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis was the site of my practicum during graduate school. I taught my first thematic unit here (it was on Washington State from WWI - WWII) and yelled at a student for the first time here (for instigating a near physical fight with another student). I connected with my first "troubled teen" here as well: In the computer lab he pointed to the inky font he had chosen and said, "I chose this because it looks the closest to human blood," trying to shock me. I just sort of snickered and thought "this kid has no idea who he is dealing with here," and said, "better make it a deeper shade of red then, if we\'re going with realism here." Later he said something like, "Lunch is soon. I\'m hungry. It\'s been a long time since I fed on human flesh." I snapped back with, "Well, not everyone has the pallet for human, but ya dig what ya dig." At that point he was done trying to shock me and worked with me very well. My master teacher was mean and strict but I think she was just trying to teach me as much as she could in such a short time. I actually still think of her a lot.

properties.name: Hastings Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Wabiwasabi This is where Greg taught me how to play chess.

properties.name: Heraclio's Grad Pad
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is the apartment that Heraclio lived in during graduate school. He didnt have any furniture and I forced him to buy a big brown couch. I also forced him to buy decorations (that he later found creepy, actually) and lot\'s of fru-fru smell goods for the bathroom and living area. The whole scheme was to make his place both presentable to his parents and appealing to women. We spent about 300 bucks getting his place into "love pad" shape so that he\'d have a place to bring the chick who works in the cafe if he ever got the guts to ask her out (which he didnt). The guy that checked us through at Fred Meyer still asks "so how\'s that guy that you were decorating the apartment for?"

properties.name: Highlands Middle School
properties.description: Posted by Wabiwasabi This is where I went to middle school. It is also where I met Ava Hesser (now Houndsdorffer) and my first big time crush Ryan Walsh. Ava now lives in Austria with her husband (I was maid of honor at her wedding a year and a half ago), and Ryan plays in an orchestra in New York (however, we dont talk any more).

properties.name: Jerime Harrow's Childhood Home
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where Jermie Harrow grew up. He was my very first official boyfriend; we dated for 8 months in the 7th - 8th grades which is a big deal when you are 13.

properties.name: Josh and I's first date
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiAfter a month of emailing, Josh and I took a walk together and ended up on a swinging bench right about here. We talked about movies and such, our degrees and how it came to pass that we were in Richland. The things I remember most from this first date were thoughts like "wow, he sure has a lot of freckles," and noticing that Josh has a very graceful, dance-like walk. I wore sandals on this walk and by the time I ended up back at the Jadwins my feet were black with dirt. I actually have photos of it, as I went to a party at a neighbor\'s house straight after the date.

properties.name: Josh's old apartment
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiJosh lived here when I lived at the Jadwins. I had met him on MySpace because he was listed in Richland and his photo was pretty cute (he ended up being cuter than the photo). After emailing for about a month we discovered that we lived really close by and eventually we learned that I could see his apartment from my balcony. We met in real life on McMurray St and walked down to the river for our first date. What\'s weird about the whole things is that Josh is originally from Florida but had moved to New Orleans after film school. Three months later he and his room mate were fleeing hurricane Katrina. His room mate Tyler ended up in Kennewick where he was originally from, and Josh went back to Florida and lived with his mother and sister for a few months until a hurricane hit there. Sick of weird weather, Josh hopped an airplane and moved with Tyler to Kennewick and then to Richland. The apartment he lived in was next door to Tyler\'s brother and sister-in-law\'s apartment and oddly enough, I had had a creative writing class with Tyler\'s sister-in-law about five years before this. She had seen my photo one day when Josh was emailing me and said "hey, I know that girl!" ...and that\'s how Josh and I knew that the other wasnt a killer of children.

properties.name: Kid's Place
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is the day care that Josh worked at when I met him. I ended up working here with him the summer before I started student teaching.

properties.name: Lunch Break Smoke
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where Robin and I would go on our lunch break during high school and smoke cigarettes. I found the skeleton of a dog here once and collected the bones and brought them back to one of the science teachers (later I had my tonsils taken out and the doctors let me have them. I wanted to bring them into the science teacher but the school wouldnt allow it...something about a "bio-hazard." God I was a weird kid!!!).

properties.name: My Childhood Home
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where my family lived from sixth grade through high school and where I lived after mom died and dad moved during junior college and while I earned my BA. I lived with a boyfriend for the first time in this house.

properties.name: My First Experience Skiing
properties.description: Posted by Wabiwasabi This is roughly the area where I water Skied for the first and only time in my life. I lasted all of two seconds and I was done.

properties.name: My First French Kiss
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiMy first french kiss occured roughly here, in the 9th grade. This was Kendra Cummings\' family\'s apartment. The boy I kissed was named Jason Wimpy - seriously.

properties.name: My First Smooch
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiMy first smooch occurred here in the sixth grade. The boy\'s name was Robbie Shwartz and I believe he was the only Jewish boy I ever kissed until Josh.

properties.name: My Mother's Grave
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiMy mother is buried roughly here. She has a flat headstone that reads "Lisa Grunenfleder 1959 - 2001, "We love you, pussycat,\'" that I picked out. People often walk their dogs here, which I found strange when I\'ve gone their to grieve.

properties.name: My very first apartment.
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis was my very first apartment. When I was 23 I moved out of my father\'s house with a boy I was engaged to. I was dumped in this apartment and lived alone with two terriers for close to a year. I got my first job out of college while living here, I turned 24 here and I learned to love living alone here. I used to spend my evenings listening to my music, dancing around the living room with my dogs while wearing a burka my dad had brought back for me from Afghanistan. I kept over two hundred books in my dining nook and decorated the living room quite nicely, though it often smelled because of the two dogs (dogs need space...lesson learned!). The apartment was what they call "adorable" which meant that it was tiny but had a fireplace. Josh lived down the street from me and I could see his apartment from my balcony, though we met officially on the internet (it\'s a small world, small town, strange story). When I moved out of the apartment the landlords ended up screwing me pretty bad - I would not recommend this place to anyone!

properties.name: Our First House
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is Josh and I\'s first house we ever rented. For the first nine months we lived here with his old room mate Tyler and Tyler\'s awful girlfriend. Tyler was a nice enough fellow and was easy to get a long with, but his girlfriend had a massive chip on her shoulder, especially once they got married. I think she was threatened by me or maybe just thought I was weird. What ever the case, she wasnt very pleasant and I danced with joy when they broke the lease and moved out after they were married.

properties.name: Rite Aid
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis was my first job.

properties.name: Robin's Childhood Home
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where Robin Bogert grew up. She was my best friend in high school and I ended up living with her the summer after my mom got the transplant in my junior year. We used to hang out in her back yard, indulge in some questionable activities and listen to punk rock (though she was always way more hip than I was). This is where I shaved my head (with the help of Robin, of course) and where I went immediately after my mother\'s funeral.

properties.name: Southridge High
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where I went to high school. I had many friends here but only a few became life long (Robin, Deej). I hated this place with every fiber of my being, which I think is really silly now. It\'s hilarious that what felt at the time was "the worst times of my life" would be later regarded by my adult self as some of the best times of my childhood.

properties.name: The Alley Behind the T-Room
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiI took Josh to the T-Room for our second date. He had never been there, and it\'s sort of a seedy little joint, so I took him in around through the back entrance down an alley just for effect. We sat at the big, circular red booth in the bar room and talked. We both ordered a drink but neither of us finished. Two months later, in a booth across from this one, Josh and I would have our first kiss in the drunken haze of a 24th birthday bash.

properties.name: The Good Subway
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is what Heraclio and I call "the good Subway." We actually travel out of our way to go to this Subway instead of the one on George Washington Way due to an unfortunate incident involving olives and a grumpy manager.

properties.name: Two Rivers Park
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is Two Rivers Park at the confluence of the Columbia and Snake Rivers. The big "lake" is the best for swimming as the smaller of the two is really just a pool of goose poop at the height of the season. This is a great place for birthday parties or get togethers but it can get pretty crowded. Ava and I spent whole summers in our childhood here. This is a great place for inflatable rafts and exploring. There is a sand bar between the peninsula area and the land to the right that can be walked across but it drops off close to land and can be very deep if the water is high. This area is also where you can see the "Finley Ghost."

properties.name: Umatilla Chemical Depot
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis the rough location of my first job out of high school. I was paid 10$/hr and worked four tens. My position was some sort of clerk position and I often was in charge of the site switchboard as well as escorting public officials on to the site. This site has a stockpile of chemical weapons that dates back to WWII (original rail lines as well as some buildings are visable from the highway). This site is not open to the public, nor, I think, will it ever be. Non-military staff carry gas masks and Mark I kits, temporary authorized personell have to tote oxygen tanks. Bunkers that are seen from the highway do not contain chemical weapondry. Usually they are empty or are used to store excess office equipment (chairs, desks, etc). Chemical detectors, early warning systems, radios and emergency plans make this site safer than one might think. Though the chemical weapons are deadly, the processes used to destroy them are highly regulated which makes this site a safe place to work or live near.

properties.name: WSU Tricities:Heraclio's and My Haunt
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is where I earned my BA in history as well as my Master\'s in Education. I met Heraclio here in 2004 while he too was earning his history degree. I had noticed that he took all the same classes that I took so I figured he was my best shot at a friend at this small satellite school. On the last day of finals I saw him sitting on a couch outside the auditorium where our next final was going to be held. I sat on the other end of the couch, put my legs on his lap and said, "Want to go to a party?" I can\'t imagine what he thought at that point...he probably thought I was hitting on him, though I was just being overly familiar more than anything. After that we spent every week day together at the university and walked together when we graduated. After graduation he moved to Seattle and worked in a warehouse and I stayed here and worked at a pay day loan joint (these are the things one does with a history degree). My job was super dead end, and a year later I woke up one day and called the school to ask when the application dates were for grad school. I was lucky, and I had a week left to get all the paper work in. I called Heraclio and left him a message on his voicemail, "Hey H, it\'s me. Pack your shit, come back home, we\'re going to grad school." Heraclio moved back within a week and we started graduate school a month later. I don\'t know if either of us could have done grad school without the other. Academically we are a great team and have a truly epic friendship. Our only gripe is that, both being History teachers, we\'ll probably never get jobs in the same school (but that hasnt stopped us from dreaming).

properties.name: Wheat Fields
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is the rough area where you will find the most beautiful wheat fields in our area. They are particularly handsome when still green, but by harvesting time they look like a sea of gold. To the left (if you are heading South) is a view of the Columbia (eventually you see some really nice columns out there as well). This is where I used to go when I got stressed out. FYI, there is no cell service out here.

properties.name: Winco/Waremart
properties.description: Posted by WabiwasabiThis is the Waremart that Ava, Jermie and I used to walk to in middle school. One day after school we saw giant flames leaping off the roof and we screamed "Waremart\'s on fire! Waremart\'s on fire!" It turned out that the apartment buildings kitty corner to it were actually on fire but from where we were standing it appeared that Waremart was on fire. Ava and I once walked here with out legs taped together with orange duct tape.
